document_data.name: Blueberry
document_data.mainbody: '''Blueberries''' were a common type of berry in the Realms that grew on bushes.
document_data.Habitats:
Places in the Realms where blueberries were known to grow included:
* [[Cormanthor]], particularly in the [[Cormanthor#Starwood|Starwood]]. 
* [[Cormyr]] produced hundreds of acres of blueberries. Some of the settlements that were known to farm them included [[Thunderstone]] There were also bogs to the west of [[Kirinwood]] that yielded bushels of blueberries.
* The [[Silvershield estate]] in [[Baldur's Gate]].
* In [[north Faerûn]], they could be found in the [[Earthspur Mountains]].
* In [[northwest Faerûn]], they could be found in the [[Nether Mountains]].
document_data.History: In the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]], a farmer from Thunderstone named [[Del Geery]] used the dried skin of a [[hydra]] to make coverings for his [[raspberry]], blueberry, and [[strawberry]] bushes. This covering kept the air around them at a cool {{SI|70|F|long=yes}}, extending their growing period deep into autumn. The hydra hides proved to be effective only on these three types of berry bush.
document_data.Species: * [[Bilberry]], a species of blueberry that was endemic to the [[High Moor]] plateau and the [[Serpent Hills]].
document_data.Usages:
* The [[bear]]s that inhabited the forest of Cormanthor particularly favored [[gooseberry|gooseberries]] and blueberries to most other food.
* The [[High Flagon]] in [[Waterdeep]] offered its patrons sweet [[tart]]s with blueberry filling.{{Cite dragon/302/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: The High Flagon|77}}
* Blueberries were gathered by the [[Disciples of St. Sollars the Twice-Martyred]] and used to brew a [[wine]] that they were famous for.
* Blueberries were one of the many types of edible berries in the Realms that could be used as [[material component]]s for the [[spell]] ''[[goodberry]]''.
* Some used blueberries in the treatment of certain medical conditions, such as dropsy and typhoid.<ref>
* The [[Green Hag of Lizard Marsh]] used blueberries to cook up a [[hag]] frozen treat called "Eye Scream", as described in ''[[the Witch's Brew Cookbook]].''
